title: IOS 18
content:
{{Short description|2024 mobile operating system}}
{{pp-vandalism|small=yes}}
{{lowercase title}}
{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2024}}

'''iOS 18''' is the [[IOS version history|eighteenth and current major release]] of [[Apple Inc.|Apple]]'s [[iOS]] operating system for the [[iPhone]].<ref name="macrumors roundup">{{Cite web |date=January 12, 2024 |title=iOS 18: Everything We Know |url=https://www.macrumors.com/roundup/ios-18/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240115074916/https://www.macrumors.com/roundup/ios-18/ |archive-date=January 15, 2024 |website=MacRumors}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Peter |first=Kostadinov |date=June 10, 2024 |title=iOS 18: Release date predictions, anticipated features, and compatible iPhones |url=https://www.phonearena.com/ios-18-release-date-features-news-compatible-iphones |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240610083825/https://www.phonearena.com/ios-18-release-date-features-news-compatible-iphones |archive-date=June 10, 2024 |website=[[Tom's Guide]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Miller |first=Chance |date=June 10, 2024 |title=iOS 18 is coming today: Here's everything we know |url=https://9to5mac.com/2024/06/10/ios-18-new-features-release-date-more/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240610181351/https://9to5mac.com/2024/06/10/ios-18-new-features-release-date-more/ |archive-date=June 10, 2024 |website=9to5Mac}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Sareena |first=Dayaram |date=June 10, 2024 |title=iOS 18: New Features, Siri AI, Apple Intelligence and More Expected at WWDC |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-18-new-features-siri-ai-apple-intelligence-and-more-expected-at-wwdc/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240610152249/https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/ios-18-new-features-siri-ai-apple-intelligence-and-more-expected-at-wwdc/ |archive-date=June 10, 2024 |work=[[CNET]]}}</ref> It was announced on June 10, 2024, at the 2024 [[Worldwide Developers Conference]] (WWDC). It was made publicly available on September 16, 2024, as a free software update for supported iOS devices.<ref>{{Cite web |title=iOS 18 |url=https://www.apple.com/ios/ios-18/ |access-date=2024-09-15 |work=Apple |archive-date=September 15, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240915201203/https://www.apple.com/ios/ios-18/ |url-status=live }}</ref> It is the direct successor to [[iOS 17]] and was announced alongside [[iPadOS 18]], [[macOS Sequoia]], [[watchOS 11]], [[visionOS 2]], and [[tvOS 18]].

== System features ==

=== Apple Intelligence ===
{{Main|Apple Intelligence}}
The [[Apple Intelligence]] platform is available in iOS 18.1 and beyond on the [[iPhone 15 Pro]] and iPhone 15 Pro Max models as well as the [[iPhone 16]] and [[iPhone 16 Pro]] models. Apple Intelligence adds artificial intelligence (AI) capabilities and [[large language model]] integrations to [[Siri]] and other operating system functions, such as the [[Photos (Apple)|Photos]] app.<ref name="macrumors roundup" /><ref name="intelligencesupport">{{Cite web |last=Prospero |first=Mike |date=June 10, 2024 |title=Here are the devices that will support Apple Intelligence — no older iPhones allowed |url=https://www.tomsguide.com/ai/here-are-the-devices-that-will-support-apple-intelligence-no-older-iphones-allowed |access-date=June 10, 2024 |website=Tom's Guide |language=en |archive-date=June 11, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240611153848/https://www.tomsguide.com/ai/here-are-the-devices-that-will-support-apple-intelligence-no-older-iphones-allowed |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Adorno |first=José |date=January 4, 2024 |title=iOS 18: Release date, AI, supported iPhones, and everything we know |url=https://bgr.com/guides/ios-18/ |access-date=January 15, 2024 |website=Boy Genius Report |archive-date=January 15, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240115074916/https://bgr.com/guides/ios-18/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

Apple's Intelligence features are set to be introduced gradually across several forthcoming updates. These features were not included in the initial release of the iPhone 16 models.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Spence |first=Ewan |title=Apple's New iPhone 16 Pro Delivers Delight And Disappointment |url=https://www.forbes.com/sites/ewanspence/2024/09/22/apple-iphone-16-pro-review-good-bad-specs-camera-control-apple-intelligence-new-iphone/ |access-date=2024-09-23 |website=Forbes |language=en |archive-date=September 23, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240923125140/https://www.forbes.com/sites/ewanspence/2024/09/22/apple-iphone-16-pro-review-good-bad-specs-camera-control-apple-intelligence-new-iphone/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Calculator ===
{{Main article|Calculator (Apple)}}
iOS 18's Calculator introduces Math Notes, a new feature that allows users to perform and track calculations on separate sheets, solve [[Equation|mathematical equations]], and [[Graphing calculator|plot functions on graphs]]. With integrated handwriting recognition, Math Notes automatically evaluates user input and displays the results in their own handwriting. The redesigned Calculator app, now shared between iOS and [[IPadOS 18|iPadOS]], marks the first time an official calculator has been available for iPad.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Solve math with Math Notes in Calculator on iPhone |url=https://support.apple.com/en-bh/guide/iphone/iph46efa613a/ios |access-date=2024-09-18 |website=Apple Support}}</ref>

=== Messages ===
{{Main article|Messages (Apple)}}
iOS 18 supports [[Rich Communication Services]] (RCS) on supported conversations, including support for read receipts and higher-quality multimedia sharing across various platforms. As with [[SMS]], it is designated with green message bubbles and buttons to distinguish it from blue [[iMessage]] conversations.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Johnson |first=Allison |date=June 10, 2024 |title=Apple is bringing RCS to the iPhone in iOS 18 |url=https://www.theverge.com/2024/6/10/24171315/apple-messages-rcs-ios-18-imessage-green-bubble |access-date=June 10, 2024 |website=The Verge |language=en |archive-date=June 10, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240610174135/https://www.theverge.com/2024/6/10/24171315/apple-messages-rcs-ios-18-imessage-green-bubble |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Miller |first1=Chance |date=November 17, 2023 |title=RCS messages will use green bubbles, Apple confirms |url=https://9to5mac.com/2023/11/16/apple-confirms-rcs-messages-will-have-green-bubbles/ |access-date=November 19, 2023 |website=9to5Mac |archive-date=November 18, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231118203335/https://9to5mac.com/2023/11/16/apple-confirms-rcs-messages-will-have-green-bubbles/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Availability of RCS messaging varies by carrier availability and compatibility.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple officially rolls out RCS for iPhone, but many carriers still don't support it |url=https://www.zdnet.com/article/apple-officially-rolls-out-rcs-for-iphone-but-many-carriers-still-dont-support-it/ |access-date=2024-09-19 |website=ZDNET |language=en |archive-date=September 19, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240919042513/https://www.zdnet.com/article/apple-officially-rolls-out-rcs-for-iphone-but-many-carriers-still-dont-support-it/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Apple previously refused the adoption of RCS in iOS.<ref>{{cite web |last=Ulanoff |first=Lance |date=November 16, 2023 |title=Hell freezes over – Apple to support RCS messages from Android phones next year |url=https://www.techradar.com/phones/iphone/breaking-apple-will-support-rcs-in-2024 |access-date=August 27, 2024 |website=TechRadar}}</ref>

In 2022, after being questioned about RCS potentially coming to iPhone to increase compatibility with [[Android (operating system)|Android]], [[Tim Cook]] said that iPhone users were not expressing interest in RCS and instead suggested that a solution would be to switch to an iPhone to use iMessage. The person who asked the question followed up, explaining that they use an iPhone while their mom uses an Android phone, to which Tim Cook jokingly replied "Buy your mom an iPhone" to large controversy.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Lawler |first=Richard |date=2022-09-08 |title=Tim Cook says 'buy your mom an iPhone' if you want to end green bubbles |url=https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/7/23342243/tim-cook-apple-rcs-imessage-android-iphone-compatibility |access-date=2024-07-21 |website=The Verge |language=en |archive-date=September 8, 2022 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20220908054542/https://www.theverge.com/2022/9/7/23342243/tim-cook-apple-rcs-imessage-android-iphone-compatibility |url-status=live }}</ref> The quote was later cited in an [[Competition law|anti-trust]] lawsuit against Apple Inc. filed by the [[United States Department of Justice]].<ref>{{Cite web |last=Bitter |first=Alex |date=March 22, 2024 |title=Watch Tim Cook's famous 'Buy your mom an iPhone' quip that caught the attention of the Justice Department |url=https://www.businessinsider.com/tim-cook-buy-your-mom-iphone-doj-apple-complaint-2024-3 |access-date=2024-07-21 |website=Business Insider |language=en-US |archive-date=July 21, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240721043355/https://www.businessinsider.com/tim-cook-buy-your-mom-iphone-doj-apple-complaint-2024-3 |url-status=live }}</ref>

In iMessage, Animated effects can be applied to any letter, word, or phrase, and text formatting such as bold, italic, underline, and strikethrough can be applied to any part of the text as well.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Rossignol |first1=Joe |title=iMessage on iOS 18 Features Bold, Underline, Italics, and Text Effects |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2024/06/10/ios-18-imessage-features/ |website=MacRumors |access-date=October 15, 2024 |date=June 10, 2024}}</ref> Both can be used simultaneously but cannot be used with the same selected text, however.

=== Photos ===
{{main|Photos (Apple)}}
iOS 18 includes a significant redesign of the Photos app.<ref>{{Cite web |title=iOS 18 Preview |url=https://www.apple.com/ios/ios-18-preview/ |access-date=June 10, 2024 |website=Apple |language=en-US |archive-date=June 10, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240610182101/https://www.apple.com/ios/ios-18-preview/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.engadget.com/apple-redesigned-the-photos-app-in-ios-18-to-intelligently-organize-your-memories-174959393.html |title=Apple redesigned the Photos app in iOS 18 to intelligently organize your memories |first=Karissa |last=Bell |date=2024-06-10 |access-date=2024-07-04 |website=[[Engadget]] |archive-date=July 16, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240716160808/https://www.engadget.com/apple-redesigned-the-photos-app-in-ios-18-to-intelligently-organize-your-memories-174959393.html |url-status=live }}</ref> Slideshows known as collections are now automatically generated and visible at the top of the screen.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Younker |first=Scott |date=2024-07-08 |title=iOS 18 Photos — Apple explains the biggest redesign in years |url=https://www.tomsguide.com/phones/iphones/apple-explains-the-photos-app-redesign-what-they-think-you-want |access-date=2024-07-16 |website=Tom's Guide |language=en |archive-date=July 16, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240716225629/https://www.tomsguide.com/phones/iphones/apple-explains-the-photos-app-redesign-what-they-think-you-want |url-status=live }}</ref> Support for encoding/decoding the [[International Organization for Standardization|ISO]] 21496-1 [[High dynamic range#Storage|gain map]] standard for [[High dynamic range|HDR]] images was added, which allows for cross-platform HDR compatibility while remaining backwards compatible with [[Standard-dynamic-range video|SDR]] displays.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Mishaal |first=Rahman |date=2024-10-29 |title=Google and Apple are making HDR photos work better on Android and iOS |url=https://www.androidauthority.com/google-apple-hdr-photo-standard-3495035/ |access-date=2024-11-11 |website=Android Authority |language=en}}</ref> This redesign has led to backlash from many users who find it too confusing and is said to be the most controversial change in iOS 18.<ref>{{Cite web |author1=Lloyd Coombes |date=2024-08-11 |title=User backlash has reportedly caused Apple to rethink iOS 18's Photos redesign |url=https://www.imore.com/apps/user-backlash-has-reportedly-caused-apple-to-rethink-ios-18s-photos-redesign |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=iMore |language=en |archive-date=November 21, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241121085107/https://www.imore.com/apps/user-backlash-has-reportedly-caused-apple-to-rethink-ios-18s-photos-redesign |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |author1=Mark Wilson |date=2024-09-18 |title=Hate the new iOS 18 Photos app? Try these fixes to make it more like the old version |url=https://www.techradar.com/phones/iphone/hate-ios-18s-new-photos-app-try-these-fixes-to-make-it-more-like-the-old-version |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=TechRadar |language=en |archive-date=November 19, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241119112934/https://www.techradar.com/phones/iphone/hate-ios-18s-new-photos-app-try-these-fixes-to-make-it-more-like-the-old-version |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Home screen ===
iOS 18 allows users to customize the icon color as well as the icon position and size on the home screen.<ref>{{Cite web |date=March 27, 2024 |title=What to Expect From iOS 18, Apple's Biggest iOS Update Yet - iDevice Central |url=https://idevicecentral.com/apple/what-to-expect-from-ios-18/ |access-date=June 10, 2024 |website=iDevice Central |language=en-US |archive-date=March 27, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240327194530/https://idevicecentral.com/apple/what-to-expect-from-ios-18/ |url-status=live }}</ref> A toggle to activate dark mode icons for first-party apps and many third party ones was implemented. Previous iOS versions arranged icons on a preset grid, but now users can place them anywhere. App Widgets may now be resized in-place or reduced to a normal app icon as desired.

In August 2024, a new feature was introduced which enables users to edit the iPhone home screen through iPhone Mirroring, and is available in the latest betas of iOS 18 and iOS 18.1.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Mishra |first=Prakruti |date=2024-08-14 |title=Apple adds home screen management to iPhone mirroring in new betas: Report |url=https://www.business-standard.com/technology/tech-news/apple-adds-home-screen-management-to-iphone-mirroring-in-new-betas-report-124081400716_1.html |website=[[Business Standard]]}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=McAuliffe |first=Zachary |date=2024-08-16 |title=Every Way You Can Customize Your iPhone's Home Screen in the iOS 18 Betas |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/services-and-software/every-way-you-can-customize-your-iphones-home-screen-in-the-ios-18-betas/ |access-date=2024-08-14 |website=[[CNET]] |language=en |archive-date=August 14, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240814102001/https://www.cnet.com/tech/services-and-software/every-way-you-can-customize-your-iphones-home-screen-in-the-ios-18-betas/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Control Center ===
{{Main|Control Center (Apple)}}
iOS 18 comes with a redesign to the [[Control Center (Apple)|Control Center]], allowing for multiple pages of controls, resizable buttons, and third-party controls.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Hardwick |first=Tim |date=June 10, 2024 |title=iOS 18: New Control Center Features Multiple Customizable Screens |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2024/06/10/apple-ios-18-control-center-multiple-screens/ |access-date=June 11, 2024 |website=MacRumors |language=en-US |archive-date=June 10, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240610194756/https://www.macrumors.com/2024/06/10/apple-ios-18-control-center-multiple-screens/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

=== Passwords ===
{{Main|Passwords (Apple)}}
Apple introduced [[Passwords (Apple)|Passwords]], a [[password manager]] aimed at simplifying password management for websites, applications, [[Wi-Fi]], and verification codes.<ref name="WSJ2024">{{Cite news |last1=Tibken |first1=Shara |last2=Stern |first2=Joanna |author-link2=Joanna Stern |date=June 11, 2024 |title=Password App, iPad Calculator, Scheduled Text Messages: What's Coming Soon to Your Apple Devices |url=https://www.wsj.com/tech/personal-tech/ios-18-ipados-18-iphone-apple-features-fall-2024-70d28f09 |url-access=subscription |access-date=June 11, 2024 |work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] |archive-date=July 16, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240716160809/https://www.wsj.com/tech/personal-tech/ios-18-ipados-18-iphone-apple-features-fall-2024-70d28f09 |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{cite magazine |url=https://variety.com/2024/digital/news/ios-18-whats-new-apple-iphone-release-1236033603/ |title=Apple iOS 18: What's New in the Latest iPhone Software Release |first=Todd |last=Spangler |date=2024-06-11 |access-date=2024-07-04 |quote=The new Passwords app provides a single place to access passwords, passkeys, Wi-Fi passwords and verification codes. The app also includes alerts for users regarding common security weaknesses, such as passwords that are easily guessed or used multiple times, as well as those that appear in known data leaks. |magazine=[[Variety (magazine)|Variety]] |archive-date=July 6, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240706173051/https://variety.com/2024/digital/news/ios-18-whats-new-apple-iphone-release-1236033603/ |url-status=live }}</ref> This new app is heavily inspired by and replaces the Passwords section that was previously found in [[List of built-in iOS apps#Settings|Settings]], with the addition of Wi-Fi passwords. All existing passwords and codes in Settings are automatically moved to the Passwords app upon updating.

=== Locking/hiding applications ===
In iOS 18, applications that are visible to the user can be locked or hidden. Locked apps require [[Security and privacy of iOS|passcode/biometric authentication]] to run. Hidden apps are moved to a designated 'Hidden' folder in the [[IOS#App Library|App Library]]; accessing that folder requires passcode/biometric authentication.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Clover |first=Juli |date=June 10, 2024 |title=iOS 18 Lets You Lock and Hide Your Apps for Added Privacy |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2024/06/10/ios-18-hide-lock-apps/ |url-status= |website=MacRumors}}</ref> Hidden apps do not show in other places on the phone such as Siri Suggestions and the Settings app.

=== RecoveryOS ===

The new iOS 18 operating system includes RecoveryOS on the iPhone 16 series that allows users to recover and restore [[firmware]] wirelessly using another iPhone. While all iPhones running iOS 18 can recover and restore firmware for iPhone 16 models, the wireless recovery process is only supported between iPhone 16 devices.<ref>{{Cite news |title=iPhone 16 allows wireless firmware recovery using another iPhone: Report |url=https://www.business-standard.com/technology/tech-news/iphone-16-allows-wireless-firmware-recovery-using-another-iphone-report-124091800692_1.html}}</ref>

=== Others ===
With iOS 18.1, iOS allows the detection and display of battery health information of a non-Apple battery.<ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-11-07 |title=iPhone Repair: Impact of iOS 18.1 on Aftermarket Parts |url=https://rewa.tech/impact-of-ios-18-1-on-aftermarket-parts/ |access-date=2024-11-14 |language=en-US}}</ref>

With iOS 18.2, users are able to share a link with others or airlines to track the location of [[AirTag|AirTags]] or other accessories in the [[Find My|FindMy]] app.<ref>{{Cite web |title=Apple's Find My enables sharing location of lost items with third parties |url=https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2024/11/apples-find-my-enables-sharing-location-of-lost-items-with-third-parties/ |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=Apple Newsroom |language=en-US |archive-date=November 23, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241123013103/https://www.apple.com/newsroom/2024/11/apples-find-my-enables-sharing-location-of-lost-items-with-third-parties/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |date=2024-11-11 |title=Apple Announces iOS 18.2's New AirTag Location Sharing Feature Coming to These 15+ Airlines |url=https://www.macrumors.com/2024/11/11/apple-announces-airtag-location-sharing/ |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=MacRumors |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Miller |first=Chance |date=2024-11-11 |title=Apple teams up with airlines for new 'Share Item Location' AirTags feature in iOS 18.2 |url=https://9to5mac.com/2024/11/11/ios-18-2-share-item-location-airtags-feature/ |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=9to5Mac |language=en-US |archive-date=November 13, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241113110252/https://9to5mac.com/2024/11/11/ios-18-2-share-item-location-airtags-feature/ |url-status=live }}</ref>

Reports from law informant suggested that a new security feature was added that would reboot iPhones after 72 hours of inactivity to make it harder to hack,<ref>{{Cite web |last=Kantra |first=Suzanne |title=Apple's Secret iOS 18 Security Update Makes iPhones Safer Than Ever |url=https://www.techlicious.com/blog/a-new-reason-to-upgrade-to-ios-18/#:~:text=And%20Apple%20is%20leveraging%20that,been%20inactive%20for%2072%20hours.&text=You'll%20know%20that%20your,ID%20%E2%80%93%20just%20your%20PIN%20code. |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=www.techlicious.com |language=en |archive-date=November 21, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241121153425/https://www.techlicious.com/blog/a-new-reason-to-upgrade-to-ios-18/#:~:text=And%20Apple%20is%20leveraging%20that,been%20inactive%20for%2072%20hours.&text=You'll%20know%20that%20your,ID%20%E2%80%93%20just%20your%20PIN%20code. |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |author1=Tom Pritchard |date=2024-11-15 |title=iOS 18 will force your iPhone to reboot after 3 days — here's why that matters |url=https://www.tomsguide.com/phones/iphones/ios-18-will-force-your-iphone-to-reboot-after-3-days-heres-why-that-matters |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=Tom's Guide |language=en}}</ref> something that researchers were able to confirm while looking at the code for iOS 18.1.<ref>{{Cite web |last=Espósito |first=Filipe |date=2024-11-18 |title=Researcher reverse engineers iPhone's Inactivity Reboot feature |url=https://9to5mac.com/2024/11/18/reverse-engineers-iphone-inactivity-reboot/ |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=9to5Mac |language=en-US}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |title=Reverse Engineering iOS 18 Inactivity Reboot |url=https://naehrdine.blogspot.com/2024/11/reverse-engineering-ios-18-inactivity.html |access-date=2024-11-23 |website=Reverse Engineering iOS 18 Inactivity Reboot |archive-date=November 22, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20241122160838/https://naehrdine.blogspot.com/2024/11/reverse-engineering-ios-18-inactivity.html |url-status=live }}</ref>

== Supported devices ==

All iPhones that support iOS 17 are also compatible with iOS 18. However, the level of support varies depending on the device's system-on-chip (SoC).

iPhones with the [[A12 Bionic]] and [[Apple A13|A13 Bionic]] SoCs have limited support for iOS 18,{{Efn|Live transcriptions in ''Notes'', Eye Tracking, and Repair Assistant are not available on iPhones older than the iPhone 12 series.}} while devices with the [[A14 Bionic]] and newer SoCs receive almost full support, excluding Apple Intelligence features.

Apple Intelligence features require an [[A17 Pro]] SoC or newer, only available on the [[iPhone 15 Pro]] and iPhone 15 Pro Max.<ref name="intelligencesupport" /><ref name="preview">{{Cite web |title=iOS 18 Preview |url=https://www.apple.com/ios/ios-18-preview/ |access-date=September 8, 2024 |website=Apple |language=en-US |archive-date=June 10, 2024 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20240610182101/https://www.apple.com/ios/ios-18-preview/ |url-status=live }}</ref> Both the [[iPhone 16]] and iPhone 16 Pro, featuring the [[Apple A18|A18]] and A18 Pro SoCs, also support Apple Intelligence and full features.

The [[iPhone SE (2nd generation)]] and [[iPhone SE (3rd generation)]] are the only supported iPhones that have [[Touch ID]] and the Home Button.

Compatible iPhone models include the following:<ref>{{Cite web |last=Cipriani |first=Jason |date=September 12, 2023 |title=Here's every iPhone model that will get Apple's iOS 18 |url=https://www.zdnet.com/article/heres-every-iphone-that-will-get-ios-17/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230903152816/https://www.zdnet.com/article/heres-every-iphone-that-will-get-ios-17/ |archive-date=September 3, 2023 |access-date=December 6, 2023 |website=ZDNet |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Espósito |first=Filipe |date=September 19, 2023 |title=These are the iPhone models compatible with iOS 17 |url=https://9to5mac.com/2023/09/18/ios-17-compatible-iphone/ |access-date=December 6, 2023 |website=9to5Mac |language=en-US |archive-date=September 22, 2023 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20230922172607/https://9to5mac.com/2023/09/18/ios-17-compatible-iphone/ |url-status=live }}</ref><ref>{{Cite web |last=Teague |first=Katie |date=November 14, 2023 |title=No iOS 17 Update on Your iPhone? Here's Why |url=https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/no-ios-17-update-on-your-iphone-heres-why/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20231207180407/https://www.cnet.com/tech/mobile/no-ios-17-update-on-your-iphone-heres-why/ |archive-date=December 7, 2023 |access-date=December 6, 2023 |website=CNET |language=en}}</ref>
